required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Risk Factors for Hemodynamic Instability During Laparoscopic Pheochromocytoma Resection - Single Centre Experience

brief_summary.textblock: The aims of our study were to define perioperative HI during laparoscopic adrenalectomy for pheochromocytoma, assess the incidence of perioperative HI, and identify predictive factors of perioperative HI in our group of patients.

detailed_description.textblock: The study was a retrospective observation of consecutive patients with histologically confirmed pheochromocytoma undergoing laparoscopic adrenalectomy between years 2003 and 2019.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Hemodynamic Instability (n, %)
primary_outcome.description: Hemodynamic instability was defined as an occurrence of both intraoperative episodes of systolic blood pressure above 160 mm Hg and vasoactive (vasodilators or vasoconstrictors) drugs administration. Patients were divided into two groups: one which met both above criteria, and another one without hemodynamic instability.

secondary_outcome.description: Data on morbidity were classified according to the Clavien-Dindo classification.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Cardiovascular Complications in Patients (n, %)
secondary_outcome.description: Cardiovascular morbidity was defined as postoperative morbidity related to the cardiovascular system: postoperative hypotensive or hypertensive episodes requiring pharmacologic treatment, need for blood transfusion, myocardial or digestive ischemia, stroke, and postoperative hospitalization in intensive care unit (ICU) for cardiac-related causes.

other_outcome.measure: Number of participants who required intraoperative vasodilators administration (n, %)
Number of participants who required intraoperative vasopressors administration (n, %)
Patients with episodes systolic blood pressure >200 mmHg (n, %)
Patients with episodes systolic blood pressure >180 mmHg (n, %)
Patients with episodes systolic blood pressure >160 mmHg (n, %)
Number of participants who required postoperative vasopressorss administration (n, %)

intervention.description: Preoperative staging in all cases consisted of computed tomography or/and magnetic resonance imaging. Prior to surgery, a routine panel of laboratory tests was carried out. The catecholamines metabolites (metanephrine, normetanephrine, and methoxytyramine) were measured from 24-hour urine collection. All patients were preoperatively treated with phenoxybenzamine or alternative doxazosin.Additionally, beta-blockers in case of coexisting tachycardia were given. In the morning of the operation, preinduction blood pressure was measured. Pneumoperitoneum was achieved by insufflating CO2 gas to an intraperitoneal pressure of 12 mmHg. The operative method in our department was laparoscopic transperitoneal lateral total adrenalectomy. Intraoperatively SBP and diastolic blood pressure (DBP) were measured and recorded every 10 minutes. To treat hypertensive and hypotensive episodes, intravenous doses of urapidil, ephedrine, nitrates, MgSO4, norepinephrine, or ÃŸ-blockers were administered.

study_pop.textblock: Adult patients with histologically confirmed pheochromocytoma undergoing laparoscopic adrenalectomy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with histologically confirmed pheochromocytoma undergoing laparoscopic adrenalectomy
Exclusion Criteria:
- bilateral tumour
- no histopathological result
- neoplastic spread
